newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladeshi port workers end fighting, resume work.
newsitem.headline: Bangladeshi port workers end fighting, resume work.

text.p: Cargo handling at Bangladesh's port city of Chittagong resumed on Saturday after clashes ended between workers backed by rival political parties, port officials said.
"The situation is now quite normal as they (workers) are back to work after persuasions," Captain Zahiruddin Mahmood, chairman of the Chittagong Port Authority said.
"But I just can not rule out eruption of fresh troubles because various interest groups are active in the port."

Police said on Friday that fighting broke out when a march staged by members of the pro-government Jatiya Dock Sramik League to demand early union elections came under attack from workers backed by the opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party.
At least 20 people were injured, police said.
